events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on the highway causing moderate vehicle damage and filed the initial claim.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to the involvement of the insured vehicle in a collision.
An agent specializing in vehicle accident claims has been assigned to assist the customer and coordinate the claim process.
The customer was formally notified that their auto accident claim has been received and acknowledged by the insurance company.
The insurance company requested accident report, vehicle photos, and repair estimates for further evaluation of the claim.
The customer provided all requested documents including police report, damage photos, and mechanicâ€™s repair estimate.
Investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence and gathered additional statements from involved parties.
Investigation was completed confirming fault and validating the claim for vehicle damage due to the reported collision.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering the repair costs minus the deductible amount as per policy terms.
The customer accepted the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the timely communication and support.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance company based on the investigation results and customer's acceptance.
Payment for the settlement amount was issued electronically to the customer's registered bank account.
The auto accident claim was closed following successful payment disbursement and confirmation of customer satisfaction.
